ABOUT_ME_TEXT: Welcome! I am Daniel Schneider, a Frontend Developer from Hohenstein in the Taunus. After my many years of work as a Production Manager, I completed a professional training program at the Developer Akademie, thus fulfilling a heartfelt wish.
BULB_TEXT: Through code reviews by experienced mentors, I was able to deepen my skills and programming knowledge.
PUZZLE_TEXT: In several team and individual projects, I have demonstrated my skills in developing responsive web applications.
SKILLS_DESC_ONE: I have gained experience in developing projects
SKILLS_DESC_TWO: with various frontend technologies and concepts.
PORTFOLIO_DESC_ONE: This page is an example of my work.
PORTFOLIO_DESC_TWO: Feel free to take a look at the projects I have developed.
CONTACT_H2: Problems are there to be solved!
CONTACT_DESC: As a Frontend Developer, I am at your disposal and look forward to hearing your ideas. Please contact me via the form.
INPUT_CHECKBOX_THREE: and agree to the processing of my data as described.

project_description.join_description: Task manager inspired by the Kanban system.
project_description.pollo_loco_description: Jump 'n' Run game based on OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).
project_description.pokedex_description: A short journey back to childhood. Pokedex with a rest api.

IMPRINT_4: Information according to ยง 36 VSBG
IMPRINT_5: In accordance with ยง 36 VSBG (Consumer Dispute Resolution Act - Act on Alternative Dispute Resolution in Consumer Matters), the operator of this website declares:
IMPRINT_6: We are neither willing nor obliged to participate in dispute resolution proceedings before a consumer arbitration board.

PP_2: The controller within the meaning of data protection laws, in particular the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), is:
PP_3: Your rights as a data subject
PP_4: You can exercise the following rights at any time using the contact details provided for our data protection officer:
PP_5: Information about your data stored by us and its processing (Art. 15 GDPR),
PP_6: Correction of incorrect personal data (Art. 16 GDPR),
PP_7: Deletion of your data stored by us (Art. 17 GDPR),
PP_8: Restriction of data processing if we are not yet allowed to delete your data due to legal obligations (Art. 18 GDPR),
PP_9: Objection to the processing of your data by us (Art. 21 GDPR) and
PP_10: Data portability, provided that you have consented to the data processing or have concluded a contract with us (Art. 20 GDPR).
PP_11: If you have given us your consent, you can revoke it at any time with effect for the future.
PP_12: You can lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority at any time, e.g. with the competent supervisory authority in the federal state of your place of residence or with the authority responsible for us as the controller.
PP_13: A list of supervisory authorities (for the non-public sector) with addresses can be found at:
PP_15: Nature and purpose of the processing:
PP_16: The data you enter will be stored for the purpose of personalised communication with you. This requires you to provide a valid e-mail address and your name. This is used to allocate the enquiry and subsequently answer it. The provision of further data is optional.
PP_18: The data entered in the contact form is processed on the basis of a legitimate interest (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR).
PP_19: By providing the contact form, we would like to make it easy for you to contact us. The information you provide will be stored for the purpose of processing your enquiry and for possible follow-up questions.
PP_20: If you contact us to request a quote, the data entered in the contact form will be processed to carry out pre-contractual measures (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR).
PP_22: Recipients of the data may be processors.
PP_24: Data will be deleted no later than 6 months after the enquiry has been processed.
PP_25: If there is a contractual relationship, we are subject to the statutory retention periods according to the German Commercial Code (HGB) and delete your data after these periods have expired.
PP_27: The provision of your personal data is voluntary. However, we can only process your enquiry if you provide us with your name, e-mail address and the reason for the enquiry.
PP_29: To protect the security of your data during transmission, we use state-of-the-art encryption methods (e.g. SSL) via HTTPS.
PP_30: Information about your right to object in accordance with Art. 21 GDPR
PP_32: You have the right to object, on grounds relating to your particular situation, at any time to processing of personal data concerning you which is based on point (f) of Article 6(1) GDPR (data processing on the basis of a balancing of interests); this also applies to profiling based on this provision within the meaning of Article 4(4) GDPR.
PP_33: If you object, we will no longer process your personal data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override your interests, rights and freedoms, or the processing serves the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.
PP_36: We reserve the right to amend this privacy policy so that it always complies with current legal requirements or to implement changes to our services in the privacy policy, e.g. when introducing new services. The new privacy policy will then apply to your next visit.
PP_37: Questions for the data protection officer
PP_38: If you have any questions about data protection, please send us an e-mail or contact the person responsible for data protection in our organisation directly:
